journeys.title: Paths of Ibadah

pillars.title: Five Pillars of Islam
pillars.subtitle: The fundamental pillars that every Muslim must practice

salah.title: Salah (Prayer)
salah.description: The second pillar of Islam. Learn the 5 daily prayers from preparation, ablution, to the correct way of performing prayer

zakat.title: Zakat
zakat.description: Obligatory charity for Muslims who possess wealth above the nisab. Learn how to calculate, types of wealth, and eligible recipients

sawm.title: Sawm (Fasting)
sawm.description: Fasting during Ramadan. Learn from preparation, what breaks the fast, and worship during the blessed month

hajj.title: Hajj
hajj.description: Pilgrimage to Makkah. Learn every step from preparation, wearing Ihram, to circumambulating the Kaaba

umrah.title: Umrah
umrah.description: The minor pilgrimage that can be performed year-round. Learn the correct steps according to the Sunnah of Prophet ï·º

adhkar.title: Daily Adhkar
adhkar.description: Duas and dhikr to recite in daily life, from waking up, leaving home, eating, to before sleeping

intro.title: Welcome to the Umrah Journey
intro.description: Umrah is a journey to Baytullah (House of Allah) in Makkah to perform worship according to the example of Prophet Muhammad ï·º. It can be performed throughout the year, unlike Hajj which has a specific time.
intro.hadith: Umrah to Umrah is an expiation for sins committed between them

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Prepare yourself before departure, both physically and spiritually
details: Apply perfume (for men only, before wearing Ihram)
steps.tips: Prepare before leaving home or before reaching the Miqat

steps.title: Wearing Ihram
steps.description: Wear Ihram garments and make intention at the Miqat
details: Men: Wear two white unsewn cloths, one wrapped around the upper body, one around the waist
Women: Wear normal modest clothing, doesn't have to be white

steps.tips: After making intention, cutting nails, removing hair, using perfume, and sexual relations are prohibited

steps.title: Entering Masjid al-Haram
details: Recite dua for entering the mosque
When seeing the Kaaba, stop and make dua
Duas at this moment are accepted

dua.meaning: O Allah, open for me the doors of Your mercy

steps.tips: When seeing the Kaaba for the first time, make your most important dua

steps.title: Prayer at Maqam Ibrahim
details: If the area is crowded, pray anywhere in the mosque
steps.tips: Maqam Ibrahim is the stone where Prophet Ibrahim stood while building the Kaaba

steps.title: Shaving or Trimming Hair
steps.description: Shave or trim hair to exit the state of Ihram
details: Men: Shave the head completely (better) or trim hair all over the head
Women: Trim fingertip-length from the ends of hair (about 1-2 cm)
Shaving has more reward than trimming
steps.tips: The Prophet ï·º made dua for those who shave 3 times, and for those who trim once

completed.message: You have learned all the steps of Umrah
completed.dua: May Allah grant you the opportunity to perform Umrah soon. Ameen

intro.title: Welcome to the Salah Journey
intro.description: Salah is the second pillar of Islam, the connection between a servant and Allah. Every Muslim who has reached puberty must pray 5 times daily.
intro.hadith: The first thing a servant will be questioned about on the Day of Judgment is prayer

steps.title: Preparation
details: Wear clean clothes covering the awrah
steps.tips: Men's awrah: navel to knees | Women's awrah: entire body except face and hands

steps.title: Wudu (Ablution)
details: 7. Wash arms to elbows 3 times (start right)
10. Wash feet to ankles 3 times (start right)

dua.transliteration: Ash-hadu an la ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, wa ash-hadu anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa rasuluh
dua.meaning: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah alone, with no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and messenger

steps.tips: Recite dua after completing wudu, all 8 gates of Paradise will open for you to choose

steps.title: Niyyah (Intention)
steps.description: Make intention in the heart for prayer
details: Intend in your heart which prayer you will perform
Whether as imam, follower, or praying alone
Intention is in the heart, no need to verbalize
steps.tips: Niyyah is the intention in the heart, it doesn't need to be spoken

steps.title: Takbiratul Ihram
details: Raise hands to ear level (or shoulder level)
Place right hand over left on chest
steps.tips: Takbiratul Ihram is a pillar (rukn). Without it, prayer is invalid

dua.meaning: All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds, The Most Gracious, Most Merciful, Master of the Day of Judgment, You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help, Guide us to the straight path, The path of those You have blessed, Not of those who earned anger, nor of those who went astray

steps.tips: Al-Fatihah is a pillar, must be recited in every rakaat. Without it, prayer is invalid
